title: Yes Minister - Series 1-3 (BBC, British political satire)
description:
'Yes Minister' is a classical British comedy which 
follows the exploits of a minister, James Hacker, 
who has to wrestle with the civil service to get 
his way as his permanent secretary Sir Humphrey 
Appleby has decades of experience in how to manipulate 
politicians to do what he and his colleagues think 
is best (for themselves). 

The realism and the ideas in this comedy were fuelled 
by the quite frank and honest insider account of Richard 
Crossman in his 'The Diaries of a Cabinet Minister'. 
Even today, decades after it was first broadcast, many 
things still ring true (unfortunately). 

After the 3 series of 'Yes Minister' there was a special 
and 2 series of 'Yes Prime Minister'.
